videoData.title: Meet the robot designed like an octopus tentacle
videoData.socialTitle: Meet the robot designed like an octopus tentacle

nodes.whoTheyAre: Carl Vause is the CEO of Soft Robotics, a Cambridge, Massachusetts-based company that designs and manufactures robotic grippers capable of manipulating items of various sizes, shapes and weights without the help of computer vision. The breakthrough devices are crucial to the operativity of industrial robotic arms, providing the capacity to grab items without breaking, tearing or crushing them. Prior to joining Soft Robotics, Vause has held a variety of senior positions in technology and medical devices companies. He also served as a Naval Flight Officer with the U.S. Navy.

videoData.description: Everyday, robots perform tasks like picking apples, screwing lids on jars and sewing. But while robots excel at many things, designing them to grasp and handle delicate items has been a challenge. In this tech demo, robotics entrepreneur Carl Vause explains how the octopus tentacle inspired him to develop a machine capable of picking up the most fragile of objects.
